title: rustdoc link resolution is nondeterministic, depends on job number

labels.name: T-rustdoc
labels.description: Relevant to the rustdoc team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: T-cargo
labels.description: Relevant to the cargo team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
rust-analyzer generates documentation by running `cargo doc --all --no-deps` in CI, but I've noticed that the resulting documentation doesn't have *any* clickable links, even to other workspace crates. Some investigation showed that I couldn't reproduce this behavior locally unless I pass `-j1` to Cargo, which indicates that the behavior is nondeterministic.

In total, I've observed these 3 different results:

![Screenshot_20221221_184626](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1786438/208972918-7308e6c4-e993-44d3-9ecc-4dff857f2960.png)
![Screenshot_20221221_184644](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1786438/208972933-c0d4cbb6-741a-4320-9b5e-ec00c33bd18d.png)
![screenshot-2022-12-21-18:41:14](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1786438/208972957-a5653cb5-25d6-42e8-8b71-5e2104606d81.png)

These were all generated from the same commit, https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-analyzer/commit/761b127c473f8324bc9fe46a3fb502bb0a8ba6ba, using Rust 1.66.0. (the item is `hir::Semantics::speculative_expand`)
